text: Does Allegro have an event for key press

speaker: Apiza
text: There are three Event types relating to the keyboard:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_DOWN
ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_UP
ALLEGRO_EVENT_KEY_CHAR

They share the attributes


struct ALLEGRO_DISPLAY *display
int keycode
int unichar
unsigned int modifiers
bool repeat

speaker: Programmer
text: How do I register for KEY_DOWN events

speaker: Programmer
text: How do I register for keyboard events?

speaker: Apiza
text: Once the keyboard has been installed with al_install_keyboard, the keyboard can be registered as an event source with\n\n```al_register_event_source(event_queue, al_get_keyboard_event_source());```

speaker: Programmer
text: can more then one key be down at once?

speaker: Apiza
text: Using the ALLEGRO_EVENT_QUEUE struct, multiple keys can be down at once. Every key press will add a new ALLEGRO_EVENT to the ALLEGRO_EVENT_QUEUE, even if other keys are being held.

speaker: Programmer
text: FALSE

speaker: Programmer
text: keybdnu.c:190: al_get_keyboard: Assertion `new_keyboard_driver' failed.

speaker: Apiza
text: Keyboard errors may emerge if the keyboard driver is not successfully installed.

speaker: Apiza
text: You can call al_is_keyboard_installed to confirm that the driver has installed properly:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```bool al_is_keyboard_installed(void)```

speaker: Programmer
text: How do I install the keyboard?

speaker: Apiza
text: ```bool al_install_keyboard(void)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Install a keyboard driver.

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns true if successful. If a driver was already installed, nothing happens and true is returned.

text: How do I play sound files?

speaker: Apiza
text: To play sound, the audio add-on and audio codec add-on must be installed.\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```bool al_install_audio(void)```\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```bool al_init_acodec_addon(void)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: There are several functions to play audio samples.

speaker: Apiza
text:
The simplest is al_play_sample
:

speaker: Apiza
text:
```bool al_play_sample(ALLEGRO_SAMPLE *spl, float gain, float pan, float speed,
 ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE loop, ALLEGRO_SAMPLE_ID *ret_id)```

speaker: Apiza
text: An ALLEGRO_SAMPLE must first be reserved and loaded.\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```bool al_reserve_samples(int reserve_samples)```\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```ALLEGRO_SAMPLE *al_load_sample(const char *filename)```

speaker: Programmer
text: what is the parameter reserve_samples

speaker: Apiza
text: int reserve_samples - refers to the number of sample instances to be reserved and attached to the default mixer

speaker: Programmer
text: what are the valid gain values for al_play_sample?

speaker: Programmer
text: I need documentation for al_play_sample

speaker: Apiza
text: gain - relative volume at which the sample is played; 1.0 is normal.\ngain is a float

speaker: Apiza
text: Sure, here's the documentation:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: al_play_sample\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```bool al_play_sample(ALLEGRO_SAMPLE *spl, float gain, float pan, float speed,
 ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE loop, ALLEGRO_SAMPLE_ID *ret_id)```

speaker: Apiza
text: Plays a sample on one of the sample instances created by al_reserve_samples.

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns true on success, false on failure.

speaker: Apiza
text: Playback may fail because all the reserved sample instances are currently used.\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
Parameters:

gain - relative volume at which the sample is played; 1.0 is normal.
pan - 0.0 is centred, -1.0 is left, 1.0 is right, or ALLEGRO_AUDIO_PAN_NONE.
speed - relative speed at which the sample is played; 1.0 is normal.
loop - ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE_ONCE, ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE_LOOP, or ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE_BIDIR
ret_id - if non-NULL the variable which this points to will be assigned an id representing the sample being played. If al_play_sample returns false, then the contents of ret_id are invalid and must not be used as argument to other functions.

speaker: Apiza
text: See also: ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE, ALLEGRO_AUDIO_PAN_NONE, ALLEGRO_SAMPLE_ID, al_stop_sample, al_stop_samples, al_lock_sample_id.

speaker: Programmer
text: How do I draw text on the display

speaker: Programmer
text: I need documentation for al_draw_text

speaker: Apiza
text: Three are several methods to Draw text on the display.

speaker: Apiza
text:
The simplest is

```void al_draw_text(const ALLEGRO_FONT *font,
 ALLEGRO_COLOR color, float x, float y, int flags,
 char const *text) ```

speaker: Apiza
text: The font add-on must first be initialized.\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: ```bool al_init_font_addon(void)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: An ALLEGRO_FONT struct can be loaded with\n\n```ALLEGRO_FONT *al_load_font(char const *filename, int size, int flags)```

speaker: Apiza
text: Sure,

speaker: Apiza
text: here it is:\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: al_draw_text\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
```
void al_draw_text(const ALLEGRO_FONT *font,
 ALLEGRO_COLOR color, float x, float y, int flags,
 char const *text) ```

speaker: Apiza
text: Writes the NUL-terminated string text onto the target bitmap at position x, y, using the specified font.\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
The flags parameter can be 0 or one of the following flags:

ALLEGRO_ALIGN_LEFT - Draw the text left-aligned (same as 0).
ALLEGRO_ALIGN_CENTRE - Draw the text centered around the given position.
ALLEGRO_ALIGN_RIGHT - Draw the text right-aligned to the given position.
It can also be combined with this flag:

ALLEGRO_ALIGN_INTEGER - Always draw text aligned to an integer pixel position. This was formerly the default behaviour. Since: 5.0.8, 5.1.4

speaker: Apiza
text: This function does not support newline characters (\\n), but you can use al_draw_multiline_text for multi line text output.\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: See also: al_draw_ustr, al_draw_textf, al_draw_justified_text, al_draw_multiline_text.

speaker: Programmer
text: define ALLEGRO_COLOR

speaker: Apiza
text: typedef struct ALLEGRO_COLOR ALLEGRO_COLOR;\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text: An ALLEGRO_COLOR structure describes a color in a device independent way.

speaker: Apiza
text: Use al_map_rgb et al. and al_unmap_rgb et al. to translate from and to various color representations.

speaker: Programmer
text: what are the parameters for al_load_font

speaker: Apiza
text: ```ALLEGRO_FONT *al_load_font(char const *filename, int size, int flags)```\n\n

speaker: Apiza
text:
The flags can be 0 or

ALLEGRO_TTF_NO_KERNING - Do not use any kerning even if the font file supports it.

ALLEGRO_TTF_MONOCHROME - Load as a monochrome font (which means no anti-aliasing of the font is done).

ALLEGRO_TTF_NO_AUTOHINT - Disable the Auto Hinter which is enabled by default in newer versions of FreeType. Since: 5.0.6, 5.1.2
